channel.title: Comments on: BULK INSERT data where the row terminator is a linefeed in SQL Server

item.content:encoded: Thank you soooooooooooooooooooooooooo much! And your step-by-step look at other possibilities was really a nice touch!

item.title: By: caveman2009
item.dc:creator: caveman2009
item.content:encoded:
The last example worked for me.
As does modifying the third example to use ROWTERMINATOR = ‘0x0a’

BULK INSERT SomeTable
FROM ‘D:JunkdrawImportMe.txt’
WITH (FIELDTERMINATOR = ‘t’,
FIRSTROW =2,
ROWTERMINATOR = ‘0x0a’) –CHAR(10) or ‘l’ does not work – 0x0a is the hex code for linefeed CHAR(10)

From http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/sqlserver/en-US/cc0d3f79-3b1e-4613-881e-ba54289a5f02/bulk-insert-row-terminator-issues
